intro: Vahlodea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in composite heads, and their succulent, fleshy leaves. Vahlodea species are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture due to their hardy nature and ornamental value. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
